Shell#

Here, functions for the shell and the class arg are shown and described.

namespace shell#

Functions

void background(string colour)#

Change background of the shell.

Parameters:

colour – background colour

void chapter(std::string text, bool newline = true)#

Print a chapter of a help page.

Parameters:

  • text – chapter title

  • newline – Print a new line

void cout(mml::string text, bool newline = true, std::string colour = "lightgreen")#

Print to the shell.

Note

Text within [] is highlighted

Parameters:

  • text – The text to be printed

  • newline – New line at the end

  • colour – which colour is used for highligting

void error(std::string text)#

Print an error in red colour and exit the program.

Note

This function exits the program

Parameters:

text – to be printed

void formation(string format)#

Change the formation of printed texts in the shell.

Possible options are “normal”, “fat”, “cursive”, “underline”, “blink”, “reverse”

Author

Mike

Parameters:

format – Format

void letter(string colour)#

Change printed text colour.

Options are black, darkgray, (light)red, (light)green, brown, yellow, (light)blue, (light)purple, (light)cyan, white, lightgray, normal

Parameters:

colour – paint of the letters

void normal()#

Reverse changes in the print behaviour of the shell.

void note(std::string text, bool newline = true)#

Print a note in lightgray.

Parameters:

  • text – to be printed

  • newline – print newline

void option(std::string option, std::string descr)#

Print an option in a help page.

Parameters:

  • option – Name of the option used

  • descr – Description of the option

std::string password(std::string print, std::string add)#

Input of a password.

Parameters:

  • print – text to be printed when the code asks for the password

  • add – additional text printed after print

Returns:

input

void warn(std::string text, bool newline = true)#

Print a warning and exit the program.

Parameters:

  • text – Text to be printed

  • newline – Print new line

void warn_opt(std::string text, bool newline = true)#

Print a warning without exiting the program.

Parameters:

  • text – Text to be printed

  • newline – Print a new line

class arg : public mml::vector<mml::string>#
#include <shell.hpp>

Public Functions

inline arg(int argc1, char **argv1)#

Initialize with the arguments from the main class.

Parameters:

  • argc1 – Number of arguments

  • argv1 – Arguments

Returns:

Instance of the class

Initialize with the arguments from the main class.

Parameters:

  • argv1 – Arguments

  • argc1 – Number of arguments

Returns:

Instance of the class

Constructor.

Parameters:

args – Values to be put into the class

Constructor.

vec_copy – Instance of this class

template<typename ...values>
inline std::vector<mml::string> &operator()(int argc1, char **argv1, const values&... value) noexcept#

Initialise with the values from the terminal and separated flags given with one minus sign.

Parameters:

  • argc1 – Number of arguments

  • argv1 – Character vector with the arguments from the shell

  • value – Values which are not separated

Returns:

Reference to this instance

std::size_t begin(const std::string &str) const noexcept#

Determine position where an argument starts with a specific string.

Parameters:

str – element starts with this string

Returns:

Position

template<typename ...values>
inline void init(const values&... value) noexcept#

Determine options given with one minus and separate them ignoring specific strings.

Parameters:

value – Values which are not separated

template<typename ...values>
inline bool nexist(const values&... value) const noexcept#

Determine if an element does not exist.

Parameters:

value – values to be looked for

Returns:

true, if values do not exist

std::size_t pos(const std::string &str) const noexcept#

Determine the position of a searched string.

Parameters:

str – Value to be looked for

Returns:

position

std::size_t pos(const std::string &str1, const std::string &str2) const noexcept#

Determine the position of a searched string or another.

Note

If str1 exists, then the position of this string is returned. Only if not, then the position of str2 if it exists

Parameters:

  • str1 – Value to be looked for

  • str2 –

Returns:

position

template<typename T>
inline std::vector<mml::string> replace(T Old, T New) noexcept#

Replace a string in each element.

Parameters:

  • Old – value to be replaced

  • New – new value

Returns:

Vector of this instance
